ygData.subject: RE: Maid and Butler camping?
ygData.msgSnippet: IMO you should always carry a druid or wiz in your pocket so you can evac if ya have to, druid preferably for regen or heals
ygData.messageBody:
IMO you should always carry a druid or wiz in your pocket so you can evac if
ya have to, druid preferably for regen or heals

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Greg Gillan [SMTP:GGillan@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, November 23, 1999 10:48 AM
> To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
> Subject: [eqbards] Maid and Butler camping?
>
> From: Greg Gillan <GGillan@...>
>
> I think the time has come that I pick up an ebw. I've got a ykesha for my
> primary, but I'm not sure I'm willing to do that camp again for a while.
> The ebw seems like a good choice for a secondary weapon anyway since its
> faster than the ykesha, and off hand proc's never seem to happen much for
> me.
> Anyway, not having a whole lot of experience with MM, I know how to get to
> the maid and butler rooms, but I'm not really very familiar with spawns
> and
> aggro radius' in there, I was just wondering if anyone can offer any
> advice.
> Where is the best/safest place to camp? Can I do it solo, or should I
> bring
> along anyone else? About how long does it take on average to get both
> fangs?
> Any advice would be helpful.
>
>
> Elwyn Heartstring
> Level 50 Bard
> Erollisi Marr
>
> > Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to lol@...
> with the subject submissions.
